item.description:
This should be great, with all the new snow we are going to have our first non-groomed get together at Harold Parker State Forest. There are portable outhouses and trail maps on site. No groomed trails but great conditions and has been skied over so some manmade tracks. Thirty-five miles of trails to choose from. NO RENTALS but you can rent gear at REI, EMS or Joe Jones. They may not have water, so bring your own. Some of the people going will have backcountry skis, some will have classic skis, skating is not recommended. Snowshoeing will be excellent. Please get there in time to start skiing at 10:00 AM, we plan on skiing to 2:00 PM. We will see how to break up into groups based on who comes, but we will probably have two groups. Bring food if you want to eat.

Here is the link to the park description and trailmap, I recommend you print the map and put it in a plastic bag just in case. http://www.mass.gov/d... If you have a trail compass you may want to bring it.

Bring a cell phone in case you need help on the trails. My cell phone is 617 460 6126 in case you are having trouble finding me at the parking lot.

Directions:
Take rte one north to 114 north to Harold Parker Road take right and at the intersection of Middleton Road take a left, the parking lot is 100 yd to the left and can accommodate 10 to 15 cars. http://maps.google.co...

Thanks to Sheila for researching this event!
item.how_to_find_us: I will be parked at the headquarters, wearing a Santa hat

group.name: The Boston Cross-Country Skiing and Snowshoe Meetup Group

item.name: Harold Parker State Forest, Andover MA
